project.name: SocialVideoPlayer API
project.description: The API for the Social Video Player, for use in developing plugins.

PluginAPI.name: PluginAPI
PluginAPI.description: A reusable and generic plugin API.
PluginAPI.author: Aaron Olkin

client.core.svp.name: client.core.svp
client.core.svp.description: The base object for the application.

client.core.Plugin.name: client.core.Plugin
client.core.Plugin.description:
Plugin functionality, as amended by the SVP core. To view the plugin 
constructor documentation, please see
{{#crossLink "client.api.Plugin"}}here{{/crossLink}}.

client.api.plugins.name: client.api.plugins
client.api.plugins.description: The global object which core code can hook into.

client.api.Plugin.name: client.api.Plugin
client.api.Plugin.description:
Sets up a plugin constructor and adds it to the list, initializing it immediately
depending on the value of plugins.loaded.

This page documents the default Plugin object. Core code will usually extend it,
so you should look at {{#crossLink "client.core.Plugin"}}{{/crossLink}} to see
all of the functionality available to a plugin.

client.core.WSChat.name: client.core.WSChat
client.core.WSChat.description: The WSChat constructor (bad style...possible refactoring candidate?)

protocols.WebTorrent.name: protocols.WebTorrent
protocols.WebTorrent.description:
The WebTorrent Protocol Specification and Documentation ================================================================== "Methods" describe messages sent by clients to the server. "Events" describe messages received by clients from the server. A username must be supplied to use the WebTorrent protocol. Identification is accomplished using the "subprotocol" feature of WebSockets. *(This protocol is in early alpha and is subject to change)* How WebTorrent Works ------------------------------------------------------------------ WebTorrent allows files to be transmitted between clients by breaking up files and sending individual 2MB (that size is not finalized yet) blocks at a time. When a client would like to share a file, it must assign it a unique ID no longer than 64 characters (Usually the filename, or a hash of it) and share that ID with the receiving client. The receiving client then sends a tracking request broadcast, and the current owner of the file must respond with a "request" (oops) containing more detailed information about the file. The receiving client should then have enough information to begin requesting file blocks. At any point, a client may send a "request" with a file id and block number to any other client. If that client has that block of that file, it should respond with a binary message to the requesting client containing a 64 character bytestring of the file ID followed by a two byte unsigned integer specifying the file block, and then the actual data of that block. If the client does not have that block, it may ignore the request. It is up to the requesting client to keep track of what blocks it has and what it needs.
*The parameters listed below should be supplied to the client side JavaScript WebSocket constructor.*

params.name: names
params.description: An array of possible usernames for this client

classitems.description:
Bootstrap.js by @fat & @mdo
plugins: bootstrap-transition.js, bootstrap-modal.js, bootstrap-dropdown.js, bootstrap-scrollspy.js, bootstrap-tab.js, bootstrap-tooltip.js, bootstrap-popover.js, bootstrap-affix.js, bootstrap-alert.js, bootstrap-button.js, bootstrap-collapse.js, bootstrap-carousel.js, bootstrap-typeahead.js

Called to display the information associated with a given video in the
"Load a New Video" dialog box.
classitems.name: updateVideoInfo

classitems.description:
Called when the volume is adjusted using the slider
(which should be the only way for the volume to change).
*For Plugin use, see {{#crossLink "svp/syncVolume:event"}}here{{/crossLink}}.*
classitems.name: syncVolume

classitems.description: Fired when the volume is adjusted.
classitems.name: syncVolume

params.name: volume
params.description: The new volume as a decimal

classitems.description:
Called on video timeupdate, it takes care of updating all the various counters,
timelines, etc, as well as broadcasting the update.
classitems.name: syncPos

classitems.description: Handles skip/ff controls.
classitems.name: transportClick

classitems.description: Broadcasts information about a jump.
classitems.name: broadcastJump

params.name: from
params.description: The username from which the jump originated

classitems.description: Broadcasts information about a state (playing/paused) change.
classitems.name: broadcastStateChange

classitems.description: Called to reset who is being synced to when the local user takes an action.
classitems.name: resetSync

classitems.description: Adds all of the DOM elements and configuration for a new "watcher".
classitems.name: addWatcher

classitems.description: Loads a new video into the DOM and resets objects.
classitems.name: loadVideo

params.name: id
params.description: A semi-random ID for identifying this viewing session

classitems.description: Allows editing of the video url before loading it into the video element.
classitems.name: videoUrl

classitems.description: Turns the lights on!
classitems.name: lightsOn

classitems.description: Turns the lights out!
classitems.name: lightsOff

classitems.description: Called when a play/pause event is needed, for whatever reason.
classitems.name: stateChange

params.name: from
params.description: The username of the person who initiated the state change

classitems.description: Called when the player or a playpause button is clicked.
classitems.name: playPause

classitems.description:
Called to process and display a chat message.

If the player is not aware of the specified "from" user, it will create a new
random color to use. This color will persist if that username reoccurs.
classitems.name: receiveChat

params.name: from
params.description: The username of the person who sent the message ("You" if the local user)

params.name: message
params.description: The message he or she sent

params.name: time
params.description: The timestamp for the message (if left out the current time is used)

classitems.description: The WSChat instance responsible for transmitting data between clients.
classitems.name: ws

classitems.description: Handles WSChat errors.
classitems.name: wsError

classitems.description: Handles WSChat "messages".
classitems.name: wsMessage

params.name: from
params.description: The user who sent the message

classitems.description: Receives private WebSocket plugin messages.
classitems.name: plugin

params.name: data
params.description: Depends on the plugin that sent the message

classitems.description: Handles WSChat "broadcasts".
classitems.name: wsBroadcast

params.name: from
params.description: The user who sent the message

classitems.description: Receives special WSChat plugin broadcasts that are independent of the current video ID.
classitems.name: pluginGlobal

params.name: data
params.description: Depends on the plugin that sent the message

classitems.description: Receives WSChat plugin broadcast messages.
classitems.name: pluginBroadcast

params.name: data
params.description: Depends on the plugin that sent the message

classitems.description: Handles WSChat quits (when another client disconnects).
classitems.name: wsQuit

classitems.description: Called on initialization of the WSChat client.
classitems.name: init

params.name: name
params.description: The username that the local client will save and use

classitems.description: Initializes the WSChat client.
classitems.name: initializeClient

params.name: name
params.description: The username that the local client will save and use

classitems.description: Creates a new element for a plugin to use.
classitems.name: requestDiv

params.name: size=0
params.description:
Pass a zero for a smaller-width container or a one
for a larger container. Other sizes do not exist at this time.

return.description: a jQuery array containing a single div

classitems.description: Registers a string filter for chat messages using a regex.
classitems.name: useFilter

params.name: regex
params.description: This filter will only be applied if the regex matches

params.name: callback
params.description: The method to register. It will be called in the context of the plugin.

params.name: notOnInit
params.description: If `true`, this filter will not be applied to existing messages

return.description: The registration ID, can be used to unregister the filter later. (Note: unregistering is not implemented yet.)

classitems.description: An object that holds assembled plugin constructors to prevent reloading.
classitems.name: plugins

classitems.description:
Set by the core code when all preset plugins have been initialized
and it is ready. It allows plugins loaded in the future to be
instantiated immediately.
Holds arrays of event callbacks.
classitems.name: handlers

classitems.description: Holds arrays of editor callbacks.
classitems.name: editors

classitems.description: Holds arrays of string filters.
classitems.name: filters

classitems.description: Loads all preloaded plugins and tells future plugins to load immediately.
classitems.name: init

params.name: it
params.description: This argument is ignored at the moment

classitems.description: Core code should call this to post an event for plugins to catch.
classitems.name: event

params.name: type
params.description: Either a function (whose name will then be used) or a string

params.name: args
params.description: An array of arguments available to callbacks

example: plugins.event(null,arguments); // will use the name of the callee from the arguments variable

classitems.description: Core code should call this to allow plugins to filter certain strings.
classitems.name: filter

params.name: *arguments
params.description:
Any additional arguments will still be
    passed through, as an array

classitems.description:
Core code should call this to allow plugins to make changes to arbitrary objects
or change default behaviors.
classitems.name: editor

params.name: type
params.description: Either a function (whose name will then be used) or a string

classitems.description: Mostly a wrapper around a jQuery.getScript call, it provides some URL help.
classitems.name: load

params.name: url
params.description:
The URL/name of the plugin to load. If it does not
    end with .plg.js, or at least .js, those suffixes will be added.

return.description: The jQueryXHR object for the AJAX request

classitems.description: Called upon plugin loading attempts.
classitems.name: loadPlugin

params.name: url
params.description: The full URL to the plugin.

classitems.description: Registers a event handler with the plugin API.
classitems.name: register

params.name: type
params.description: The event type to register with

params.name: callback
params.description: The method to register. It will be called in the context of the plugin.

return.description: The registration ID, can be used to unregister the handler later.

classitems.description: Registers a event handler with the plugin API.
classitems.name: useEditor

params.name: callback
params.description: The method to register. It will be called in the context of the plugin.

return.description: The registration ID, can be used to unregister the editor later.

classitems.description: Registers a string filter with the plugin API.
classitems.name: useFilter

params.name: regex
params.description: This filter will only be applied if the regex matches

params.name: callback
params.description: The method to register. It will be called in the context of the plugin.

return.description: The registration ID, can be used to unregister the filter later. (Note: unregistering is not implemented yet.)

classitems.description:
Creates a new element for a plugin to use.
*This method is designed to be overwritten by the core code.*
classitems.name: requestDiv

return.description: a jQuery array containing a single div

classitems.description:
The number of times this client has tried to connect to the server
since the last success.
classitems.name: retries

classitems.description: Whether this client is currently connected.
classitems.name: closed

classitems.description: Whether this client should log debug info to the browser console.
classitems.name: log

classitems.description: Initializes a WSChat client and connects to the specified server.
classitems.name: init

params.name: url
params.description: The websocket url to connect to

params.name: noretry
params.description: Whether to attempt to recconnect if the connection is lost

classitems.description: The underlying WebSocket instance that handles the raw communication.
classitems.name: socket

classitems.description: Sends a message to the specified client.
classitems.name: message

params.name: to
params.description: The user to send the message to

classitems.description: Broadcasts a message to all connected clients.
classitems.name: broadcast

classitems.description: Performs the actual sending operation.
classitems.name: send

params.name: data
params.description: The object to be serialized and sent

classitems.description:
Closes the underlying websocket. However, unless the WSChat instance
is in noretry mode it will immediately attempt to reopen the connection.
classitems.name: close

classitems.description: Called on receipt of a message.
classitems.name: onmessage

params.name: from
params.description: The username of the person who sent the message

classitems.description: Called on receipt of a broadcast.
classitems.name: onbroadcast

params.name: from
params.description: The username of the person who sent the broadcast

classitems.description: Called on receipt of a WSChat error.
classitems.name: onerror

params.name: code
params.description: The numeric identifier for the WSChat error

classitems.description: Called when a websocket error occurs.
classitems.name: onwserror

classitems.description: Called when a client disconnects from the server.
classitems.name: onquit

params.name: who
params.description: The username of the client who quit

classitems.description: Called when the websocket closes for any reason.
classitems.name: onclose

classitems.description: Called on a successful connection and identification to the server.
classitems.name: onconnected

classitems.description:
If a message begins with an ASCII NUL ("\0"), it is interpreted
as a binary message, otherwise it is assumed to be JSON.

If a client tries to send a message without having identified
properly (without specifying a username), they will simply be
disconnected.
classitems.name: Any Message

classitems.description:
After the signifying first NUL byte, a binary message should
specify the client(s) to forward the message to, terminated
by another NUL. The entire message after that NUL will then
be forwarded directly to the specified clients(s).

*Sending binary messages to multiple clients at once has
not been implemented yet.*
classitems.name: Binary Message

classitems.description:
When one client sends a binary message, the receiver will
receive the exact message, but with no "from" information.
classitems.name: Binary Message

classitems.description:
JSON messages can be either fileblock requests or tracking
broadcasts.
classitems.name: JSON Message

classitems.description:
A "tracking" message will be broadcast to all connected
clients as is, except a "from" parameter will be added to
specify the sender.
classitems.name: JSON type:tracking

classitems.description:
A "request" message will be forwarded as is to the specified
client, with a "from" parameter added to specify the sender.
If the specified receiver is invalid, a JSON message of type
"error" and error "badclient", with a "message" attribute
containing the original message, will be sent.
classitems.name: JSON type:request

classitems.description:
If the sent message is the string "list", a list of
connected clients will be printed to stdout.
classitems.name: list

classitems.description:
When one client disconnects, all other clients receive this
message (for tracking purposes).
classitems.name: JSON type:quit

params.name: who
params.description: The name of the client that disconnected

classitems.description:
The server will pick the first specified username that is
available and return it, allowing the client to determine
what username is in use through the "protocol" attribute
of the JavaScript WebSocket. If none is available, the
server will close the connection, although the client is
free to try to connect again with the same or different
usernames.
classitems.name: WebSocket.protocol

classitems.description:

params.name: who
params.description: The name of the client that disconnected

classitems.name: WebSocket.protocol
